Selecting from Multiple Attribute Forms

Certain columns (more specifically, certain attributes), can be represented in multiple ways. For instance, a customer often has both an ID number as well as a name. The same is generally true for products, months, and other elements that can go into the report. When you expand an attribute column header, you will also see a select option for which form of the attribute you want to display:

In this example, the SUPC field can be represented as either a name, ID, or a description of that product. If you would like to see all three, you can click on all options. When you do this, the report will bring back three columns for the SUPC – one for the name, one for the code, and another for the description.
